meta.description: Club Aspire at London Heathrow Airport (LHR), Terminal 3. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Club Aspire

location.terminalDirections: Located near Gate 9, lounge is signposted as "Lounge D" on the right hand side.

lounge.description: This brand new lounge incorporates the best of contemporary design with a number of dedicated zones to ensure that travellers can work, pamper themselves, or simply rest before their journey. Highlights include a dedicated rest area with lounger seats, business traveller services, on-site showers, and a best-of British food menu.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
regulatory: This lounge is accessible to passengers departing from Terminal 3 only.
Access to this lounge is permitted up to 3 hours before the scheduled flight departure time.

Advanced bookings are limited to a maximum of 5 people. The lounge reserves the right to ask unauthorized groups, and groups that arrive separately on multiple bookings, to disperse or leave the lounge.

reviews.content: Small but since I have PP it‚Äôs better than what you get at T5. Breakfast was good - no issues with PP at 6:30am. Was starting to get a bit loud as I left at 7:30.
Too many kids. Wish they would have an adult only area and a room for screaming children. Need cheese and crackers even at breakfast. No snack foods at breakfast time.
It's an average lounge where people can enter by paying. Everything is OK but nothing special. Food selection average. It is clean and modern enough but that's it.
Breakfast is not bad, although limited, lunch changeover is at 11am. A bit crowded.
As past reviews, crowded with people, decent food selection. Friendly staff, reasonable bar.
Crowded and cramped. Somewhat better food options than No1, which isn‚Äôt saying much. Good amount of outlets.   Decor okay for the cramped space. Priority Pass just doesn‚Äôt have good T3 options.
The food consisted of pasta, quiche, a salad bar, cheese and crackers etc. Only juice and coffee were available for self-service. For anything else you had to queue up to get it from the bartender.
Usually visit the other Priority Pass lounge fancies a change. Food and drinks were as to be expected. Staff were a bit slow but most were super friendly. Only small but very quite! No runway view.
Good view of the runways. Good seating options. Limited food options.
OMG worst ever. Food terrible (what little there is). Cold and unappetizing. Most tables not cleared. Noisy. Bar is ok but slow service. Go elsewhere. Not even close to the description.
Did the job but not worth the money. Crowded, noisy, ‚Äúrest pods‚Äù and ‚Äúquiet area‚Äù immediately next to the main part of the lounge so not quiet at all. Save your money.

Arrived on a Wed just after opening at 0530. Almost no one in the lounge. Nice hot breakfast line, various juices and cereals. Bar looked nice but didn‚Äôt order any drinks. Used PP card: no problems.
Nice view of the tarmac, but incredibly crowded and no restrooms inside the lounge. Decent food.
Nice lounge if you‚Äôre at Heathrow.
Disappointing. Limited food and drink options. The bathroom is not clean. I wished I‚Äôd have chosen another lounge.
Comfortable, clean, quiet and not too busy (entered about 18:30). Food options rather carby (rice, pasta, no proteins or significant salad dishes on offer). For the price not bad at all. Would return
Another "we don't care" lounge. Coffeemaker not working, so send customers to the other end of the lounge to get it there (instead of servicing the machine). Wifi painfully slow. At least it's quiet.
Very unique lounge with theater room, private spaces for calls or seclusion, and a spa. Great food and beverage selection.
Awful worst lounge, not worth the money.
Not bad, but small and noisy. They have resting pods which was very helpful. Clean.
Was here first thing in the AM so it was nice and quiet. Nice breakfast selection and well maintained interior. Staff very courteous.
If you value being away from the hustle & bustle of a terminal then this works. The food options very limited/poor and the internet connection was poor. Would pay a little extra for a better lounge.
I understand the negative reviews since I've been to far better lounges even for the same price. But this is still a small, busy, noisy yet clean and comfy lounge with a decent breakfast.
I prefer the No1 lounge for Priority Pass - food options around lunch time really not great... two types of bland pasta around lunch, no thanks.
Good breakfast food options, can almost make yourself a full English. Clean, modern and choice of both bottled and draught beer (Tiger and Moretti respectively).
Great service, very friendly staff. But very lousy food. I should have sat at a Weatherspoon.
Great lounge overall. No order in foods but not crowded when I came at 11am and comfortable seating. Definitely worth the detour.
Turned away with Priority Pass, claimed it was too full. Didn't seem full to me. Told I needed to go to No1 lounge instead.
Open food area not very hygenic.
It's a nice enough lounge. Modern, clean, with ample charging points. Food selection limited & just OK. I would forgive that were it not for the wifi issues, it packed up after just over an hour.
Nothing bad to say. It's modern and pretty. Never full. Chargers everywhere. Food. Drinks. üëçüèª
Decent food, clean facilities, overall nice.
Not huge, but cozy and fresh. A decent option if you are paying cash, ¬£29/per person. Buffet meh - frozen quiches, pizza and some salads. Bar is OK.
Just a short stroll from the terminal shops, Club Aspire is an ideal place to relax before boarding. The welcoming staff keep you well fed and hydrated. Well worth the price for comfort and a meal.

A nice food and drink selection considering the price. The staff are all absolutely lovely and very helpful. A shame that a shower will set you back ¬£15 though. That should be made more clear on here.
Good service and nice space. Not very packed.

Much smaller than the No.1 lounge, but also a lot less packed. Food and drink options adequate but obviously less extensive than larger options like the Virgin Atlantic Clubhouse. I would visit again.

location.terminalDirections: Departure Level, after Duty Free, Lounge Area H
Exit to the right after the Terminal 3 Customs Hall, take the stairs or lift to Level 2.

otherLounges.name: American Airlines International First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After Passport Control, exit Duty Free Area and turn right toward Lounge Area H.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22.
Zone F, located along the corridor leading to Gates 13-22
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Lounge C in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11.
Follow the signs to 'Lounge F' towards Gates 13-22, proceed up one level via the lift or stairs.

The Lounge is in Terminal 3 Area A. After you go through security, follow Flight Connection route Area A,  access point in the main shopping and dining area to Level 2 accessible by taking the elevators.
Zone E, Level 1, along corridor with Gates 1-11
Zone B, located in the Central Concourse, near Gate 11, next to the Cathay Pacific Lounge.
Located in the Upper Class Wing.
5 minute walk from customs, just off the Arrivals Hall
